availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Nathan A. Brown (Morgan County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Morgan County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Brown. Father of Sarrah J. Brown, Leander C. Brown, and Eady Brown. Farmer in Morgan County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 45th Regiment Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Second Lieutenant from May 30, 1863 to November 3, 1863. Served in the 45th Regiment Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Major from November 3, 1863 to January 23, 1864 upon dishonorable dismissal from service due to conduct unbecoming an officer and gentleman, drunkenness on duty, and connivance at insubordination.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, District 1, p. 498.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 435.
